name: Chord Shift Workout
description: Intensive chord transition practice across multiple keys using open chords, sus voicings, dominant 7ths, and major 7ths. Each step drills a different pair of chords that belong to the same key.

steps.name: Key of C — C to G
steps.instructions: Switch between C and G every measure. Strum on each beat, focusing on clean transitions. Land all fingers together.
steps.notes: I to V in C major. Keep your ring finger anchored — it stays on the 3rd fret across both shapes.

steps.name: Key of C — G to Am
steps.instructions: Switch between G and Am every measure. Focus on moving your fingers as a unit rather than one at a time.
steps.notes: V to vi in C major.

steps.name: Key of C — Am to Em
steps.instructions: Switch between Am and Em every measure. These shapes share a similar finger pattern — lift your index finger and shift the other two down one string.
steps.notes: vi to iii in C major.

steps.name: Key of C — Em to Dm
steps.instructions: Switch between Em and Dm every measure. This is a bigger shape change — practice hovering your fingers over the target strings.
steps.notes: iii to ii in C major.

steps.name: Key of C — Dm to Cmaj7
steps.instructions: Switch between Dm and Cmaj7 every measure. The maj7 adds a dreamy quality — listen to the color change.
steps.notes: ii to Imaj7 in C major.

steps.name: Key of C — Cmaj7 to Am
steps.instructions: Switch between Cmaj7 and Am every measure. Both share the open high E string — let it ring through.
steps.notes: Imaj7 to vi in C major.

steps.name: Key of C — Dm to G7
steps.instructions: Switch between Dm and G7 every measure. This is a classic ii-V7 turnaround — the foundation of jazz and pop harmony.
steps.notes: ii to V7 in C major.

steps.name: Key of C — G7 to C
steps.instructions: Switch between G7 and C every measure. Feel the strong pull of the dominant 7th resolving home.
steps.notes: V7 to I in C major. The B in G7 wants to resolve up to C.

steps.name: Key of G — G to D
steps.instructions: Switch between G and D every measure. These are the backbone chords of countless songs in G major.
steps.notes: I to V in G major.

steps.name: Key of G — D to Em
steps.instructions: Switch between D and Em every measure. Moving from a treble-string chord to a full 6-string chord — watch your strum width.
steps.notes: V to vi in G major.

steps.name: Key of G — Em to C
steps.instructions: Switch between Em and C every measure. Em is open and wide, C is compact — practice the contrast.
steps.notes: vi to IV in G major.

steps.name: Key of G — C to Dsus4
steps.instructions: Switch between C and Dsus4 every measure. The sus4 creates tension that wants to resolve — hold it through the measure.
steps.notes: IV to Vsus4 in G major.

steps.name: Key of G — Am to D7
steps.instructions: Switch between Am and D7 every measure. A classic ii-V7 in G — the D7 pulls strongly toward G.
steps.notes: ii to V7 in G major.

steps.name: Key of G — D7 to Gmaj7
steps.instructions: Switch between D7 and Gmaj7 every measure. V7 resolving to Imaj7 — a smooth, sophisticated sound.
steps.notes: V7 to Imaj7 in G major.

steps.name: Key of G — Gmaj7 to Em
steps.instructions: Switch between Gmaj7 and Em every measure. Gmaj7 only changes one note from G — the F# on the 1st string.
steps.notes: Imaj7 to vi in G major.

steps.name: Key of G — G to Dsus2
steps.instructions: Switch between G and Dsus2 every measure. The sus2 has an open, airy sound — enjoy the texture.
steps.notes: I to Vsus2 in G major.

steps.name: Key of D — D to A
steps.instructions: Switch between D and A every measure. Two bright major chords — keep the energy up.
steps.notes: I to V in D major.

steps.name: Key of D — A to G
steps.instructions: Switch between A and G every measure. Both are strong open chords — make each one ring clearly.
steps.notes: V to IV in D major.

steps.name: Key of D — Em to A7
steps.instructions: Switch between Em and A7 every measure. ii to V7 in D — this turnaround drives the music forward.
steps.notes: ii to V7 in D major.

steps.name: Key of D — A7 to Dmaj7
steps.instructions: Switch between A7 and Dmaj7 every measure. The dominant 7th resolves beautifully into the major 7th.
steps.notes: V7 to Imaj7 in D major.

steps.name: Key of D — Dsus4 to D
steps.instructions: Switch between Dsus4 and D every measure. The sus4 creates and then releases tension — a classic resolution.
steps.notes: Sus4 resolution. Just lift your pinky to go from Dsus4 to D.

steps.name: Key of D — Dsus2 to D
steps.instructions: Switch between Dsus2 and D every measure. The sus2 opens up the chord, then D brings it back to center.
steps.notes: Sus2 resolution. Add your middle finger to go from Dsus2 to D.

steps.name: Key of D — G to Dmaj7
steps.instructions: Switch between G and Dmaj7 every measure. IV to Imaj7 — a warm, satisfying resolution.
steps.notes: IV to Imaj7 in D major.

steps.name: Key of A — A to E
steps.instructions: Switch between A and E every measure. Both are bright, full chords — keep the energy high.
steps.notes: I to V in A major.

steps.name: Key of A — E to D
steps.instructions: Switch between E and D every measure. A wide shape change — your hand crosses the neck.
steps.notes: V to IV in A major.

steps.name: Key of A — Asus2 to A
steps.instructions: Switch between Asus2 and A every measure. Just add your index finger to move from sus2 to major.
steps.notes: Sus2 resolution. A subtle but beautiful color shift.

steps.name: Key of A — Asus4 to A
steps.instructions: Switch between Asus4 and A every measure. Lift your pinky to resolve the sus4 — a tiny move with big harmonic impact.
steps.notes: Sus4 resolution. You'll hear this in the intro to countless songs.

steps.name: Key of A — D to E7
steps.instructions: Switch between D and E7 every measure. IV to V7 — building tension before going home to A.
steps.notes: IV to V7 in A major.

steps.name: Key of A — E7 to Amaj7
steps.instructions: Switch between E7 and Amaj7 every measure. V7 resolving to Imaj7 — smooth and jazzy.
steps.notes: V7 to Imaj7 in A major.

steps.name: Key of E — E to Esus4
steps.instructions: Switch between E and Esus4 every measure. Add your pinky on the G string to get the sus4.
steps.notes: I to Isus4 in E major. A staple of rock and folk guitar.

steps.name: Key of E — B7 to E
steps.instructions: Switch between B7 and E every measure. V7 to I — feel the resolution snap into place.
steps.notes: V7 to I in E major.

steps.name: Key of E — A to Emaj7
steps.instructions: Switch between A and Emaj7 every measure. IV to Imaj7 — a warm, lush pairing.
steps.notes: IV to Imaj7 in E major.

steps.name: Speed Round — G7 to C
steps.instructions: G7 to C at faster tempo. Push your accuracy at speed — if you miss, catch the next beat.
steps.notes: V7 to I in C major.

steps.name: Speed Round — Am to D
steps.instructions: Am to D at faster tempo. The ii-V change shows up everywhere — lock this one in.
steps.notes: ii to V in G major.

steps.name: Speed Round — D to A
steps.instructions: D to A at faster tempo. Precise finger placement is key — both shapes are compact.
steps.notes: I to V in D major.

steps.name: Speed Round — Dsus4 to D
steps.instructions: Dsus4 to D at faster tempo. Quick sus4 resolutions — pinky on, pinky off.

steps.name: Speed Round — E7 to A
steps.instructions: E7 to A at faster tempo. Feel the V7 pull toward the tonic — make it snap.
steps.notes: V7 to I in A major.

steps.name: Speed Round — C to Em
steps.instructions: C to Em at faster tempo. Strum with confidence through the shape change.
steps.notes: I to iii in C major.

steps.name: Speed Round — Gmaj7 to Am
steps.instructions: Gmaj7 to Am at faster tempo. Imaj7 to ii — a jazzy, flowing change.
steps.notes: Imaj7 to ii in G major.

steps.name: Speed Round — A7 to D
steps.instructions: A7 to D to close it out. V7 to I in D major — strong finish. Make it clean!
steps.notes: V7 to I in D major.
